attributes.action: Realise there is not a true seperation of the powers within UK Government
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the UK there is not a true seperation of the powers. Our constitution staes that there should be three powers; The Legislative, The Executive and The Judiciary.

These powers a fairly seperated but are not truely seperated due to the role of the lord chancellor. The Lord chancellor is involved in parliament as well as the cabinate and the House of Lords.

The Government should realise this and introduce new legislation that will allow the three powers to be truely seperated giving the people of the UK greater protection of their human rights and fair representation by the three powers.
